Employee Benefits and Perks Full-time employees receive a comprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, and a retirement savings plan with a 4% company match. Health insurance enrollment occurs during onboarding or the annual open enrollment period each November. 12. Training and Professional Development The company is committed to continuous learning and professional growth. All employees have access to an annual learning budget of $2,000 for courses, certifications, conferences, or workshops. To use this budget, employees must submit a learning request form through the HR portal, which requires manager approval. Approved expenses are reimbursed within two pay cycles after submission of receipts. Additionally, the company offers internal training sessions on topics such as cybersecurity awareness, leadership skills, effective communication, and technical tooling. Attendance at mandatory compliance training sessions is tracked and required for all employees.

Managers use a rating scale from 1 to 5, where 1 indicates underperformance and 5 represents exceptional contribution. All ratings are calibrated in cross-functional review sessions to ensure fairness and consistency across departments. Compensation adjustments, including salary increases and bonuses, are determined based on performance ratings, market benchmarks, and budget allocations. Salary reviews occur within 30 days of completing the performance cycle. Employees rated 4 or above are eligible for performance bonuses, which range from 5% to 15% of base salary. Promotion decisions are separate from annual reviews and require manager nomination, peer feedback, and approval from the leadership team.
